head.title: COVID-19 - Hallsville School District

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

nav.div: Hallsville School District » Our District » COVID-19

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial;

p.span: The Hallsville School District continues to monitor the COVID-19 situation. Please review the information below regarding communication sent on this situation.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

a.span: Update #6: COVID-19 (April 15, 2020) School Closure and FAQ

a.span: Update #1: COVID-19 (March 12, 2020) General Information with FAQ

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(47, 47, 47);

p.span: During these challenging times, we are reminded of the importance of taking time to focus on ourselves and family. This may also include focusing on your child(ren)’s mental health and well-being.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: With support from the Boone County Children’s Services Fund, several MU Centers and organizations recently partnered to create a free, searchable database of social service providers in Boone County. The database,

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: , provides access to local social services (including telehealth services) such as childcare, food, housing,

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: job training, and counseling. Collaborating MU Centers and organizations include the

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

a.span: Family Access Center of Excellence of Boone County

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

a.span: Boone County Schools Mental Health Coalition

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

a.span: Center for Evidence-Based Youth Mental Health

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: is continuing to work with school districts in Boone County to provide psychiatric evaluations and treatment for school-age children who are experiencing emotional and behavioral health issues.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: The City of Columbia has set up a webpage outlining the latest updates, health resources, programs offering assistance with food and housing, and ways to help the community during this time.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: CoMoHelps is a joint effort of Heart of Missouri United Way, City of Columbia, Boone County and Community Foundation of Central Missouri, providing a central web page with quick links to official "Get Help" and "Give Help" resources for mid-Missouri. These partners are working together to quickly determine and meet the needs of our region.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

p.span: Where can I turn for more information?

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(76, 78, 78);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(76, 78, 78);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);

a.span: Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS)

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-weight: 700; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(88, 44, 131);
background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(76, 78, 78);

p.span: activated a statewide public hotline for citizens or providers needing guidance regarding the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19. The hotline can be reached at 877-435-8411. The hotline is being operated by medical professionals and is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(76, 78, 78);
